intro: Phyllanthus ampandrandavae, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
